meanings.definition: A stroke made by a bow in a downward direction on a stringed instrument.
meanings.sent1: During the performance, the musician executed a smooth downbow on the violin.
meanings.sent2: The cellist used a downbow to create a rich, resonant sound.
meanings.sent3: The downbow on the cello made the audience sway to the music.
meanings.sent4: Her downbow was like a gentle caress on the strings, producing a melodious tune.
meanings.sent5: The downbow added depth and emotion to the musical piece.

meanings.definition: To play a stringed instrument using a downward stroke of the bow.
meanings.sent1: She downbowed gracefully, drawing out the notes with precision.
meanings.sent2: When you downbow, remember to maintain a steady rhythm.
meanings.sent3: The musician downbowed with such enthusiasm that the bow almost slipped from her hand.
meanings.sent4: His downbowing style was so unique, it mesmerized the audience.
meanings.sent5: Downbowing requires control and finesse to produce beautiful music.
